awd_titl_txt: Inversion and Analysis of Earthquake Travel Time Data with A Priori Constraints in the Imperial Valley, California
awd_abstract_narration: 9725536  Magistrale    This research involves the construction, in a forward sense, of a 3-  D seismic velocity model of the Imperial Valley, California, based  on existing geologic and seismic surveys.  Previous inversions for  the velocity structure of the Imperial Valley, although done with  extensive data sets, were difficult due to the large seismic  velocity variations over short length scales, for example between  crystalline rocks surrounding the basin and shallow sediments  within the basin, the poor resolution of inversion at shallow  depths, and the lack of accounting of model errors during the  inversion.  With the geologic information integrated in a forward  model, it will be possible to estimate the model uncertainties, and  properly account for those uncertainties during inversion.  An  improved model of faulting and crustal structure should result.  This research is a component of the National Earthquake Hazard  Reduction Program.  ***
